passages.title: Rooftop Wetlands
passages.text: Architects are experimenting with rooftop wetlands that filter rainwater and provide habitats for migrating birds. The systems layer lightweight soil, membrane liners, and shallow pools to mimic marshlands. Pilot projects in Singapore show the wetlands lowering building temperatures and capturing stormwater before it overwhelms drains. Maintenance crews must monitor mosquito populations, yet the biodiversity gains have attracted university researchers.

questions.prompt: What benefit do rooftop wetlands provide according to the passage?
Which city hosts pilot rooftop wetlands?
The wetlands eliminate the need for maintenance crews.
Why are researchers interested in the projects?
options: To convert them into shopping areas

passages.title: Revitalising Indigenous Languages
passages.text: In New Zealand, immersion preschools known as kōhanga reo helped revive Māori language use among younger generations. Similar approaches are emerging in Canada and Norway, blending community elders’ stories with digital learning apps. Success relies on training fluent teachers and producing contemporary media—songs, podcasts, and comics—that make everyday usage natural. Funding remains patchy, but language advocates partner with broadcasters to reach national audiences.

The passage states that only New Zealand is working on language revitalisation.
Which media are used to encourage everyday language use?
Who contributes stories to digital learning apps?
What challenge persists for language programmes?

passages.title: Theatre in Virtual Reality
passages.text: Theatre companies are experimenting with virtual reality (VR) to reach audiences unable to travel. Productions film performances with 360-degree cameras and overlay interactive elements so viewers can choose different character perspectives. Accessibility advocates welcome captioning and language options integrated into the VR experience. Nevertheless, companies must balance production costs with ticket prices to ensure projects remain viable.
